sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Good morning Europe, it's Wednesday the 13th of April. Thank you for joining us.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Let's begin by looking at our top stories.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: The mayor of Mariupol says 75% of the city has been destroyed and over 20,000 people have been killed.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Russia's president Vladimir Putin saying peace talks have stalled.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Leaving without anywhere to go, thousands of Ukrainians flee the country's east in anticipation of a renewed Russian offensive in the Donbass region.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: And the war in Ukraine hits UK restaurant owners hard as supplies of sunflower oil diminish and push up prices in the kitchen.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Up to 75% of the city of Mariupol is thought to have been destroyed and around 22,000 civilians may have died in the besieged city, according to its mayor.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Thousands have managed to leave, those who remain are still being shelled.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Meanwhile Putin's troops are getting into position for what will be the battle for Ukraine's eastern Donbass region.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Even though peace talks have been continuing via video link, President Vladimir Putin has dismissed them, saying they've stalled.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: News that Russian oligarch Viktor Medvedchuk, Putin's closest ally in Ukraine, had been captured has prompted President Zelensky to propose a prisoner swap. Medvedchuk, Putin's closest ally in Ukraine, had been captured, has prompted President Zelensky to propose a prisoner swap.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Medvedchuk is leader of Ukraine's opposition platform for Life Party.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: So, if Medvedchuk chose a military uniform for himself, he falls under the rules of the war time.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: I propose to Russia to exchange your guy with our men and women in Russian captivity.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: That's why it's important that our law enforcement and military agencies consider this possibility as well." Zelensky also admitted the impossibility of conducting a full investigation into claims that a poisonous substance may or may not have been dropped on Ukraine troops in Mariupol.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Meanwhile, the World Bank is planning financial support to Ukraine worth 1.4 billion euros to help keep critical services running. The bank said the funds would be used to support the continuation of key government services, including wages for hospital workers, pensions for the elderly and social programs for vulnerable people.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Russia's GDP could suffer its biggest fall since the years following the end of the USSR,

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: warned Russia's top auditor Alexei Kudrin.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: The World Bank predicted that the country's economy could shrink by more than 11% this year.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: The impact of inflation is felt on food prices.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Pasta, for example, went up by 25% and fruit and vegetables by 35% according to Rostat.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: and the State Duma on Monday proposed to order the transfer of businesses of foreign companies that are leaving Russia to the State Development Bank Web, giving the owners of such firms the option to resume their operations in Russia or sell businesses within three months. Meanwhile, state TV shows Russian businessmen, clothemakers, for example, who say that this is the time of opportunities as there are no more popular Western brands to compete with. And this is in fact what the Kremlin says explaining how sanctions eventually will make Russia as strong as ever.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Galina Polonskaya, Euronews, from Paris.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: Sanctions linked to the war in Ukraine are opening cracks in the C5, the group of five Central European countries made up of Czech Republic, Slovakia, Hungary, Austria and Slovenia.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: The informal meeting of their foreign ministers at a castle near Prague revealed their differences over the possible ban on Russian oil and gas imports.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: And for the head of Czech diplomacy, this is a priority.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: During our EU presidency, I would like to progress in the discussion on cutting oil imports from Russia, since Russia's income from the trade with the EU must be minimised." But for his Hungarian counterpart, this is a red line.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: JAN KASPER, Hungarian Prime Minister of the EU, We have signed up to all the five packages of sanctions so far.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: We have supported these measures made by the European Union.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: We have one clear red line which is the energy security of Hungary. That's why we made sure already that we cannot sign up to sanctions neither on oil nor on gas." Austria has appealed for pragmatism and to adopt sanctions that affect Russia more than Europe.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: Slovakia wants to increase military aid to Ukraine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: And Slovenia advocates ending European dependence on Russian gas and oil. Former FIFA president Sepp Blatter and former UEFA president Michel Platini will go on trial

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: in Switzerland in June to face corruption charges.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: This will be the final hearing in a long-running saga that began in 2011 and stems from a payment made by FIFA to Platini of a sum totalling 2 million Swiss francs.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: Platini demanded the payment be made over an eight-year period following the termination of his consultancy services.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: Blatter was forced to stand down in 2015 and the governing body of World Football banned him for eight years, later reduced to six.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: Blatter and Platini are charged with fraud, embezzlement, unfaithful business management and forgery of documents. Both men who were indicted in November have previously denied any wrongdoing.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: If found guilty they could receive fines or a prison sentence of up to five years.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: Police are continuing their investigation into the UK's Partygate scandal, where government

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: officials held parties during strict Covid-19 lockdown periods.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Euronews reporter Vincent McIverney brings us the latest developments from London.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: British Prime Minister Boris Johnson, his wife Kerry Johnson and the Chancellor Rishi Sunak all received the fines for a party held in June 2020.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: For the Prime Minister's birthday, it was held inside the Cabinet Room inside No. 10 Downing Street, breaking the lockdown laws that they themselves had created and imposed on the nation.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Now, both men have issued apologies unreservedly, saying that what they did was wrong, that they have paid the fines but there is growing pressure on them now to make amends the prime minister boris johnson says he will not be resigning that there's much work to be getting on with and his supporters in parliament say that given the state of affairs at the moment with the war in ukraine it is not the time to change the leader but there are many mps who have been unhappy with the prime minister's flouting of the COVID restrictions over the partygate affair.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Now, that all came to a head about six, seven weeks ago.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: A number of them had put in letters calling for a leadership contest in the week since some of those have been withdrawn.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: But the mood among the Conservative Party very much is to wait and see how the public react.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: One poll put out today said that 57% of the British public thought that Prime Minister Boris Johnson should resign.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: But at the moment, both men are staying put in their roles.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Vincent McIverney, Euronews, London.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Police in New York are trying to locate the renter of an abandoned van found near the scene of Tuesday's rush hour shooting on the city's subway.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: The driver is said to be a person of interest, having found the key to the vehicle and a credit card at the metro station.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: 23 people were injured when the suspect detonated two smoke grenades and opened fire at Brooklyn's 36th Street station shortly before 8.30 local time.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: The attacker fled the scene.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: The last time there was a mass shooting on our subway system, I believe it was 1984.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: So I don't want to act as if and treat this as a normal experience on our subway.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: This is a rarity, but one incident like this is one too many.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: normal experience on our subway. This is a rarity, but one instance like this is one too many.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: When I came out, I saw a cloud of smoke and I saw people in chaos laying on the floor, three people on the floor, and it also automatically told me to run. So I ran out and I just got out of the train station. It's definitely scary that that happened, knowing that, you know, people got hurt in the train. So it was definitely scary.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: that happened, knowing that people got hurt in the train.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: So it was definitely scary.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Police found a semi-automatic handgun, a hatchet, and a variety of incendiary devices at the scene.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: The motivation for the attack is yet unknown.
